titles.title: Bipartisan Commission on Social Security Reform Act of 2001
To establish a Bipartisan Commission on Social Security Reform.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/3/2001--Introduced. Bipartisan Commission on Social Security Reform Act of 2001 - Establishes in the legislative branch a Bipartisan Commission on Social Security Reform to design a single set of legislative and administrative recommendations for long-range reforms for: (1) restoring the solvency of the Social Security system; and (2) maintaining retirement income security in the United States.
